page.title: 02LANDSCAPE _ BORTH
page.content: Borth is a seaside town on the West coast of Wales, seven miles north of Aberystwyth University town. Dolybont village is a mile inland and Ynyslas village with its famous sand dunes and Dyfi estuary is three miles northwards Borth is an elongated settlement built on a shingle beach. The houses and cottages on one side of its main road back onto the beach and those on the other side, onto the drained bog. Borth has a glorious long stretch of beach which joins onto the Ynyslas one, and these together, give a continuous stretch of about five miles This, and the safe bathing at Borth has made it very popular with tourists Since the railway brought the first tourists in 1863, Borth has flourished its economy growing to rely on the tourist trade, with many of its small businesses closing down for the winter
